question: Which of the following measure was not adopted by the British prior to 1813 to exploit the Indians economically?
option1: Monopolising the trade of raw goods wherever possible and selling them at high rates.
option2: Forcing Indian craftsman to produce quality products in fixed quantity and at fixed price.
option4: Elimination of Indian traders from competition by every means.
explanation: British did not adopt Free trade policy to exploit the Indians economically. The measures employed were monopolising the trade of raw goods wherever possible and selling them at high rates, forcing Indian craftsman to produce quality products in fixed quantity and at fixed price and elimination of Indian traders from competition by every means.
